channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: BBC slammed for 'unbalanced' News At Ten report on Churchill
item.description: A section broadcast on Tuesday examined how modern Indians view the wartime prime minster as part of a series on Britain's colonial legacy, and featured a series of damning criticisms.

item.title: Detectives seize £2m of mafia money laundered through fake London business by Italian crime gang
item.description: Police seized dirty cash belonging to the 'Ndrangheta mafia based in the Calabria region of southern Italy. The group were using front businesses in London to clean their money.
item.media:credit: GMJ and City of London Corporation

item.title: Hogmanay cancelled: Edinburgh's New Year's Eve party that attracts 150,000 scrapped due to Covid
item.description: Edinburgh's world famous Hogmanay street party has been scrapped because of the coronavirus pandemic. Festival chiefs announced tickets will be pulled from sale and refunds given

item.title: Manufacturer Dyson announces it will cut 600 jobs in UK and 300 more in rest of the world
item.description: 'The COVID-19 crisis has accelerated changes in consumer behaviour and therefore requires changes in how we engage with our customers and how we sell our products,' a Dyson spokesman said.

item.title: Guy Ritchie gets six-month driving ban after cyclist catches him texting while behind the wheel
item.description: Mike van Erp, 48, rides around London with a GoPro to catch drivers using their phones - often in traffic jams or by red lights - and caught Guy Ritchie in November last year.

item.title: Man who used 'rough sex defence' in lover's murder to be FREED
item.description: John Broadhurst, 41, will be freed from prison in the coming weeks, less than halfway through his 44-month sentence for the manslaughter of Natalie Connolly, 26, in Kinver, West Midlands.

item.title: Coronavirus: US close to 1 MILLION new cases in two weeks
item.description: The number of infections across the country was nearing a staggering four million cases on Thursday and more than 143,000 Americans have now died from COVID-19.

item.title: 'Europe cannot fail twice on migration', EU Commission warns
item.description: Vice-President Margaritis Schinas said today the bloc cannot have similar scenes to those seen five years ago, when exiles fleeing wars, persecution or poverty flooded the continent.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon is accused of using daily Covid briefings as 'party political broadcasts'
item.description: Michelle Ballantyne, Tory MSP for South Scotland, spoke out as the PM visited the country and said the Covid crisis would have been 'disaster' for Scotland if it had been independent from the UK.

item.title: 'Firenado' spotted in explosive Californian wildfire
item.description: Cal Fire said yesterday that the fire, burning in Lassen County west of Susanville, has already scorched 9,420 acres and remains active 'five miles from Susanville'.

item.title: Barefoot daredevil scales 31-storey building in Barcelona in an hour without any climbing equipment
item.description: French YouTuber Leo Urban climbed the 381-foot Hotel Melia in Barcelona around 8.30pm on July 22. He scaled the 31-storey building without footwear.

item.title: Mansion left to rot after man killed his wife in 2005 goes up for sale for £3.25m after restoration
item.description: The once derelict Victorian mansion - Oakleigh in Altrincham, Cheshire - which was once the site of a horrific killing has been put up for sale for £3.25m after a restoration project spanning up to ten years.

item.title: Neanderthals weren't as tough as they seemed and had a LOWER pain threshold than most humans today
item.description: Genetic analysis from researchers at the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology in Germany found almost all Neanderthals had a gene which made them more sensitive to pain.

item.title: UK announces 53 more coronavirus deaths taking the UK total to 45,554
item.description: There are zero new victims in Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland , the countries' own health agencies said, suggesting today's fatalities reported by the Department of Health were all in England.

item.title: NHS finds more than 200 cases of female genital mutilation on UK-born women and girls in one year
item.description: Figures revealed more than 6,500 woman and girls in the UK had a procedure to treat their FGM or were identified as having experienced FGM previously between April 2019 and March 2020.

item.title: Shutting schools in lockdown will leave children from poorest families a YEAR behind, study finds
item.description: A new study from the University of Southampton found that children from the most 'disadvantaged' backgrounds who share computers at home will be most affected, taking 12 months to catch up.

item.title: Judge demands Mel B show how much money she made from last year's Spice Girls reunion tour
item.description: Mel B claims that she only earns $2,000 a month, has only $10,000 in the bank and owes $1.2 million in back taxes. But Mel's estimated earnings for the Spice Girls tour range from $2million to $10million.

item.title: Giving in to Temptations! Clever cat breaks into a carton of treats in under 60 seconds
item.description: The smart cat stands on her hind legs and scratches at the lid in the footage filmed in Lewiston, Maine. When the lid slips off, she starts eating the treats.

item.title: Giving in to Temptations! Clever cat breaks into a carton of treats in under 60 seconds
item.description: The smart cat stands on her hind legs and scratches at the lid in the footage filmed in Lewiston, Maine. When the lid slips off, she starts eating the treats.

item.title: Scientists discover coronavirus in the EARS of two dead Covid-positive
item.description: A new study from Johns Hopkins University found that patient had high viral loads in her right middle ear while another had high loads in his left and right middle ear and behind both ears.

item.title: Amber Heard's sister Whitney Henriquez backs her in court
item.description: Whitney Henriquez said Johnny Depp would insult Amber Heard and say he loved her in the same sentence 'with equal amounts of passion', telling her: 'You fat w***e… but God I f***ing love you'.

item.title: Boris Johnson rejects Nicola Sturgeon's demand for second independence vote
item.description: Boris Johnson today told Nicola Sturgeon that nowhere near enough time has passed since the 2014 Scottish independence referendum to require a rerun.

item.title: Covid-19 cases in Britain are still plateauing, data shows
item.description: King's College London's COVID Symptom Tracker app estimates cases in the UK have remained stable over July but are starting to increase in the North, with a predicted 1,000 new infections per day.

item.title: Tragic bride's heart-breaking Facebook message from beyond the grave
item.description: Body building queen Gemma Sisson, 39, from Leeds, West Yorkshire, said she hopes her death will serve as a warning to other sufferers to get themselves checked out.

item.title: Satanic Temple is offering its first scholarship for college students called the Devil's Advocate
item.description: The Satanic Temple, which aims to drive a wedge between religion and politics, will award two winners $500. The group is based in Salem, Massachusetts.

item.title: Brave mother wrestles her four-year-old daughter back from motorbike-riding kidnappers
item.description: Two motorcyclists can be seen attempting to take the young girl and drive her away on one of their bikes in eastern Delhi's Shakarpur area.

item.title: Light pollution interrupts the sleeping patterns of magpies and pigeons, study finds
item.description: Researchers from Australia measured the brain activity of sleeping birds, comparing this to when they were exposed to either artificial white or amber light.

item.title: Road traffic is again nearly as heavy as it was before lockdown while London still lags behind
item.description: The number of motorists on Britain's roads is up four percentage points week-on-week with figures up even higher over last weekend, according to the Department for Transport data.

item.title: Man is seized by Secret Service outside Ivanka Trump's house in early morning confrontation
item.description: A man was taken into Secret Service custody Thursday morning outside of Ivanka Trump's Washington, DC, home.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's request to gag critics is rejected by judge
item.description: Attorneys for Epstein's alleged madam Ghislaine Maxwell objected to the FBI referring to her as a 'slithering snake' at a NY press conference announcing her arrest on July 2.

item.title: Gemma Collins soaks up the sun in Tenerife amid bitter split
item.description: The TOWIE star, 39, went for a Fifties-inspired ensemble with a high-waisted bikini and an elegant straw hat as she enjoyed her holiday following her three stone lockdown weight loss,

item.title: NHS Test and Trace is failing to reach even HALF of people at risk of having Covid-19 in some areas
item.description: In Luton, which has the fifth highest infection rate in England, just 47 per cent of potentially-infected people were contacted by the system. In Leicester, tracers only hunted down 65 per cent of people.

item.title: Oxford student jailed for 18 months after caught inviting '14-year-old boy' off Grindr for sex
item.description: Oxford PhD student Shiraaz Kureembokus (pictured) claimed he was lonely during lockdown when he tried to meet the teenager - who was actually an undercover officer.

item.title: Money expert Martin Lewis walks off GMB after being rushed through his money advice segment
item.description: Finance expert Martin Lewis, 48, appeared via video link from his London home to talk about a tax free allowance, but was cut off mid-explanation by hosts Ranvir Singh and Adil Ray.

item.title: Toys including dolls and teddies belonging to Jewish child victims and survivors of the holocaust
item.description: The toys have been documented by Yad Vashem, the World Holocaust remembrance centre in Jerusalem, including a doll, wearing a child's pyjamas from Kristallnacht.

item.title: Postmistress's secret life as a cocaine pusher nicknamed 'Deidre the Dealer'
item.description: Deirdre Jenkins, 45, flogged cocaine in her Londis in Parcllyn, rural west Wales, but was arrested after refusing any more 'coke on tick' to one drug-user - who then went to the police.

item.title: JLR's new 'contactless' touchscreen tech prevents the spread of Covid-19
item.description: New patented predictive tech, developed with Cambridge University, uses artificial intelligence and sensors to control in-car 'infotainment' systems without having to touch a surface.

item.title: Man whose arm broken by Russian police CHARGED for disobedience
item.description: David Frenkel could face jail after being detained by two officers at a polling station in St Petersburg last month, in an incident where he suffered a broken arm, which can be heard in footage.

item.title: Michaela Wain insists employees need 'take care of appearance' on home video calls
item.description: Apprentice star Michaela Wain, from Bolton, who runs three businesses, divided the opinion of GMB viewers as she debatd the issue with Anju Solanki who owns a consulting firm.

item.title: Two thirds of hotel bookings in Spain have been CANCELLED
item.description: Cancellation rates are as high as 77 per cent among families and 70 per cent in the Balearic Islands which include Mallorca.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'hid raw meat around house', says Amber Heard
item.description: Amber Heard has accused Johnny Depp at the High Court in London of verbal and physical abuse during their relationship - allegedly punching, slapping, headbutting, kicking and choking her.

item.title: Lawrence of Arabia's nine-bedroom Victorian childhood home in Oxford up for sale for £2.6million
item.description: A luxurious nine-bedroom house, formerly the home of military officer T.E. Lawrence, is up for sale. Lawrence helped unite Arab tribes against the Turks in the First World War.

item.title: Face masks will be compulsory in AIRPORTS and TRAIN STATIONS
item.description: Face coverings will have to be worn in shops, supermarkets and shopping centres as well as train stations and airports under new rules set to apply across England from tomorrow.

item.title: Nazi concentration camp guard, 93, is spared jail
item.description: Bruno Dey was handed a two-year suspended sentence on Thursday by a court in Hamburg. He was an SS tower guard at the Stutthof camp near what was then Danzig, now Gdansk, in Poland.

item.title: Refugees who gang-raped an 18-year-old girl are jailed for up to five years
item.description: Ten men were handed down sentences at the district court in Freiburg today, following the assault on the teenager outside a nightclub in 2018.

item.title: Coronavirus England: 10% July hospital deaths at Kent NHS trust
item.description: Some 37 patients died from coronavirus at the East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust last month - 10.8 per cent of the 340 Covid-19 deaths across England in July.

item.title: John Travolta faces 'make-or-break' moment over devotion to Scientology after Kelly Preston's death
item.description: John Travolta is facing a 'make-or-break' moment with Scientology following his wife Kelly Preston's death. This is the second tragedy to impact Travolta after his son Jett died in 2009 at the age of 16.

item.title: Sadiq Khan's online bike course has unfortunate domain name
item.description: Sadiq Khan has been mocked after users on social media noticed the unfortunate web address chosen for the London Mayor's latest initiative aiming to get more people to cycle in the capital.

item.title: New book reveals how a 'confidence man' convinced Mormons he was a prophet and crowned himself king
item.description: A new book by journalist Miles Harvey examines the life of James Strang, a 'confidence man' who had five wives, many professions, and built a kingdom before his death on July 9, 1856.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Test all NHS staff regularly, Jeremy Hunt says
item.description: In a letter to his successor Matt Hancock and NHS England boss Sir Simon Stevens, Mr Hunt said nurses, doctors, cleaners and porters in the UK must be screened weekly.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Testing is getting SLOWER, data shows
item.description: NHS Test and Trace statistics published today showed that just 46.8 per cent of people who get swab-tested for Covid-19 in England receive their results within an hour of getting tested.

item.title: BT, TalkTalk and Plusnet broadband crash due to Newcastle fire
item.description: The cause of the issue is a fire in Newcastle affecting the networks infrastructure.

item.title: First-class delivery! Heartwarming moment postman hopscotches up garden path as he delivers the mail
item.description: A postman was caught on CCTV hopscotching up a path to deliver mail at a house in Caversham, Reading. The game had been chalked onto the path outside Jessica Hamersteen's home.

item.title: Princess Anne is the most charitable royal with 73 royal patronage visits in a year
item.description: A GivingAssistant.org study which analysed all visits by working royals to charities with a royal patronage over the course of a year, has revealed who is devoting the most time to their patronages.

item.title: Human immune systems could struggle to fight off 'alien' bacteria and viruses from other planets
item.description: Experts from Exeter and Aberdeen tested how mammal immune cells responded to amino acids that are rare on Earth but commonly found in meteorites.

item.title: Seagull snatches food from shocked blogger's hand in video
item.description: Gian Andrea Squadrilli had gone on to the balcony overlooking the sea outside his restaurant in Sorrento, southern Italy, to take a video of a slice of pizza.

item.title: Knightsbridge property developer 'bombarded Game of Thrones actress with gifts and 928 roses'
item.description: George Philippedes, 43, appeared before Brighton Magistrates accused of 'pursuing' Katie Alexander Thom, 31, with 'unwanted and unwelcome' attention amounting to harassment without violence.

item.title: Kanye West is spotted picking up baby clothes at Walmart with Damon Dash after trip to the bank
item.description: Speculation is mounting over the future of his marriage after Kanye briefly met with bankers at a First Bank in Cody, Wyoming, hours after he said he has been 'trying to get divorced' from Kim.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government 'scaremongering' caused deaths
item.description: The nurse working in the UK, who wanted to remain anonymous, said that 'hospitals were empty' apart from Covid-19 wards and ICUs and that people died because they didn't get medical care.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Spare me the 'brave Kim K' nonsense -she endorsed Kanye's bid for President
item.description: Two years ago, when Kanye West suddenly fired his manager and lawyer and professed his love for Trump, his wife Kim Kardashian lashed out at the media for 'trying to demonize my husband.

item.title: Bill Gates warns that multiple doses of any vaccine against coronavirus may be necessary
item.description: Bill Gates has spoken at length to CBS News, detailing how he believes the Trump administration made 'serious mistakes' by reopening too quickly, and speaking of his concern at school closures.

item.title: Duchess of York acts out a children's book (so is this where Beatrice's reception took place?)
item.description: Sarah Ferguson, 60, might have offered fans a glimpse at where Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi's reception took place in her latest YouTube video, filmed at Royal Lodge, Windsor.

item.title: GoFundMe campaign raises thousands for Jeremy Corbyn's legal fight over anti-semitism case
item.description: Seven former party staff members and journalist John Ware are bringing a case against the former opposition leader after he attacked successor Sir Keir Starmer's decision to settle a libel claim.

item.title: Nearly a quarter of Delhi's population infected with coronavirus, study says
item.description: Delhi has officially recorded around 126,000 cases, making it one of the world's worst-hit capital cities - and the results suggest the true figure could be as high as 6.6million.

item.title: Christian Candy allowed to build giant basement with car museum
item.description: Christian Candy's plans for the circular underground complex which can house up to 57 luxury cars on his sumptuous £150million estate in Surrey have been approved by the local council.

item.title: Woman in £1.6bn Barclays legal battle accepts apology from boss
item.description: Stephen Jones, who worked in Barclays' investment banking division, made the comment about Amanda Staveley in a telephone call in October 2008, the High Court heard.

item.title: Johnny Depp's graffiti calling Amber Heard's ex 'Taysa van Pee'
item.description: Johnny Depp sent a photograph to Amber Heard's sister Whitney of him having changing Ms Van Ree's name on the painting's glass frame in 2014, the High Court in London has been told.

item.title: How much is YOUR degree worth? How to add £6k to your salary
item.description: A study by Money.co.uk has provided insight into the highest and lowest earning degrees in Britain, revealing that studying medicine and economics could net you an extra £897,500 in a lifetime.

item.title: Sharks force two beach closures in Spain in a week
item.description: Tourists were told to avoid the sea yesterday after three blue sharks were seen off Almadrava beach on Costa Dorada, just two days after another sighting off Zahara de los Atunes on Costa de la Luz.

item.title: Bear Grylls Amazon Prime show on 'world's toughest race' in Fiji
item.description: 'Eco-Challenge', a brutal 'expedition race', saw 66 teams from 30 countries race non-stop for 11 days, 24 hours a day, across a 671km (416-mile) course that included swamps and rivers.

item.title: Brexit: Michel Barnier says UK-EU trade deal 'UNLIKELY'
item.description: He lashed out at Britain over its hardline position on fishing rights in territorial waters after the transition period ends on December 31 as talks ended without breakthrough in London.

item.title: Viewers gush over 'fit doctor' in tight shirt on This Morning
item.description: Dr Emeka Okorocha, 27, from east London, set pulses raising when appearing on This Morning today to talk to hosts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes about Kanye West and his bipolar disorder.

item.title: British drag queen turns himself into celebrities by using nothing but cosmetics
item.description: Alexis Stone, 26, of Manchester, uses his self-taught make-up skills to turn himself into a whole host of celebrities - ranging Adele to even Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg.

item.title: Irish lorry driver in court after he is extradited to the UK to face charges 39 migrant deaths
item.description: Eamonn Harrison (pictured), 23, from Mayobridge in County Down, Northern Ireland, allegedly drove the trailer to Zeebrugge in Belgium before it sailed to Purfleet in England.

item.title: Princess Diana letter written as she turned 30 emerges for auction
item.description: In the letter, which will be auctioned in Cornwall, Princess Diana wrote to close friend Dudley Poplak to thank him for three drawings he had produced for her to mark her 30th birthday in July 1991.
item.media:credit: Tim Graham Photo Library via Get

item.title: Madeleine McCann suspect investigated over boy's disappearance
item.description: Jair Soares went missing when he went to buy chips at the beach near the town of Monster in the South Holland province of the country on August 4 1995.

item.title: Hong Kong: China threatens to stop recognising BNO passports
item.description: Starting from January 2021, those in Hong Kong with such status would be able to apply for special visas to live in Britain that could eventually confer citizenship, Priti Patel said this week.

item.title: Prince Harry 'much less intelligent than' Meghan Markle
item.description: Lady Colin Campbell, based at Castle Goring, Worthing in Sussex, made the sensational claims to new! magazine while publicising her book Meghan and Harry: The Real Story.

item.title: People with psychopathic or narcissistic traits are less likely to follow face mask rules
item.description: Two studies in Poland, published today, found these people often flouted mask-wearing, hand-washing, social distancing and stay-at-home measures at the height of the pandemic.

item.title: Heatwave causes Brazilian plant sprout 8ft leaves in lockdown... just in time for garden reopening
item.description: The massive Gunnera Manicata plant, native to Brazil, has unexpectedly sprouted giant eight-foot leaves during lockdown at the Abbotsbury Subtropical Gardens in Dorset.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 leaks ahead of August launch
item.description: The standard Note 20 and Note 20 Ultra both support 5G and stream Xbox games over the cloud, according to German IT news website WinFuture.

item.title: Grandmother, 61, died from cancer weighing three stone after DWP stopped her £117.85-a-week benefits
item.description: Christine McCluskey, 61, from Dundee, Scotland, had her benefits axed after a private contractor assessed her and deemed she could walk 200 metres because she walked to her front door to let them in.

item.title: Poet discovers he is the descendant of both slaves AND slave traders
item.description: Malik Al Nasir, born in 1966 in Toxteth, Liverpool, noticed he looked similar to a black Victorian footballer and went on a 15 year journey into his family history, uncovering links to slavery.

item.title: A coronavirus vaccine will NOT be available this year, World Health Organization warns
item.description: Mike Ryan, head of WHO's emergencies programme, said the first use of a Covid-19 vaccine cannot be expected until early 2021.

item.title: Tributes are paid to 'kind and caring' girl, 16, after she was killed by a train
item.description: Jasmine Morris was struck by a train travelling between St Mary Cray and Sole Street near Cobham at around 6am yesterday.

item.title: Man raffles £1.25 million four-bedroom Sussex home for just £2
item.description: Peter Pearce, from Goring-by-sea, bought the former water tower, which sits in the private estate of Kingston Gorse and is nestled amid the beautiful seaside location of East Preston, in 2000.

item.title: Chinese state TV blacks out Premier League games
item.description: China Central Television (CCTV) played last night's blockbuster tie between Liverpool and Chelsea on CCTV+5 rather than its main football channel CCTV-5.

item.title: Cash scattered all over road at crash scene where schoolboy, 15, arrested for murder of driver, 19
item.description: The boy was arrested by police after the crash in Thame, Oxfordshire, last night. They believe the crash and attack was filmed on mobile phones by bystanders and want to see the footage

item.title: Toddler has a VERY excited reaction when he spots a lorry during his walk
item.description: Laura Whittaker, 30, caught her son Tommy's reaction on camera after he saw a truck in Manchester. He jumps up and down excitedly on the spot and shouts 'a truck'.

item.title: America is ranked one of the worst countries in the world to raise a family
item.description: America was ranked 34 out of 35 in a comparison of the world's biggest economies, compiled by travel and family experts 'Asher and Lyric'.

item.title: Twitter says hackers saw messages from 36 accounts
item.description: The scale of Twitter's vast cyber attack last week is now coming to light as the social media firm announces 36 accounts had their Direct Message (DM) inbox accessed.

item.title: Daredevil wingsuit pilot rides on her stunt partner's back as they leap from a plane at 13,000ft
item.description: Wingsuit pilot Alessio Spina leaps from a plane at 13,000 feet over Sardinia, Italy, with 28-year-old Giulia Calcaterra straddling his back in a stunt known as a 'rodeo'.

item.title: Two British climbers cheat death on French mountain
item.description: Matthew Tomlinson, 38, (pictured) and Daniel Acquah, 54, both from London, were in the final stages of a four-day climb up the infamous Peuterey Integral on Mont Blanc when a storm blew in.

item.title: Queen's £2million royal barge will get new sumptuous home on Greenwich peninsula
item.description: The vessel will be moved from St Katharine Docks in the borough of Tower Hamlets to a boathouse on the Greenwich Peninsula as part of a proposal to build the 1,500-home Morden Wharf.

item.title: RAY MASSEY tests the new £26,000 Honda e on UK roads
item.description: The perky zero-emissions Honda e, hitting UK showrooms now, is eye-catchingly cute, has bags of personality, a lively pace, and a great sense of style without being overly formal.

item.title: More than 40,000 calls were made to domestic abuse helpline since start of coronavirus lockdown
item.description: London-based Refuge's telephone helpline, which usually gets 270 calls and contacts from women, friends and family members a day, saw an increase of 77 per cent during June.
item.media:description: Refuge´s telephone helpline saw an increase of 77% during June (Dominic Lipinski/PA)

item.title: Afghan girl, 15, hailed a hero for killing Taliban fighters 'shot her own HUSBAND'
item.description: Qamar Gul was married to one of the attackers who raided her home in the Ghor province last week, according to fresh reports.

item.title: Minister who pocketed £48,000 in Russian-linked donations insists they were from 'British citizens'
item.description: Northern Ireland Secretary Brandon Lewis, who received payments of £48,000, said the donations were declared and those who made them were entitled to be involved in UK politics.

item.title: Tricky movie quiz challenges you to name 20 iconic films from a single image
item.description: The 20-question test, created by Michael Rogers for US-based site Playbuzz, asks you to name the film based on just one scene.

item.title: Dental company promoted by Vogue Williams which promises perfect teeth goes bust
item.description: The Made in Chelsea reality star and husband Spencer Matthews were guests at a glitzy celebratory lunch last May when the company boasted of fixing the teeth of 10,000 people.

item.title: Tesco customer eats nearly ALL her £3.75 chicken tray bake only find dead MOUSE in the sauce
item.description: Cath McCall Smith, from Durham, said she was left 'unwell' after allegedly finding a dead mouse in her Tesco tray bake. The 57-year-old said she initially thought she had hit a piece of bone.

item.title: Battle of the bums: Museums raise cheeky smile with online contest
item.description: Curators around the world are competing for the title of 'Best Museum Bum' as part of a social media challenge started by the Yorkshire Museum.

item.title: Wuhan family rushes to take coronavirus tests after finding a dead bat in their half-eaten pork soup
item.description: A revolting image shows the small black mammal with its wings and body curled up together as it was floating on the surface of the half-eaten broth. The family tested negative for the coronavirus.

item.title: Audi driver smashes into another car causing me to flee down busy east London street
item.description: A video, posted on Twitter, shows an alleged road rage incident in South Woodford, East London, last night, in which an Audi is seen to ram a Vauxhall Corsa, causing four occupants to flee.

item.title: Burton mother diagnosed with incurable cancer after not going to GP for a stomach ache in lockdown
item.description: Johanna William (pictured), 36, from Burton, Staffordshire, suffered abdomen pains in April but did not see her GP because she knew the NHS was 'overwhelmed'.

item.title: LUX La Baraquette: Amazonico interior designer stamps his style on these French holiday homes
item.description: The homes for sale in the port town of Marseillan in the south of France cost between €300,000 - the equivalent of £273,000 - and €4.5m - the equivalent of £4.1m.

item.title: Two Michelin starred restaurant Dinner by Heston Blumenthal launches TAKEAWAY
item.description: From Friday, Dinner by Heston Blumenthal, which is located in the five-star Mandarin Oriental in Knightsbridge, will offer a collection service for it's quirky dishes, including 'meat fruit'.

item.title: Dramatic moment lightning strikes behind Statue of Liberty as New York City is hit by a thunderstorm
item.description: The intense lightning rod was filmed from a dock on Ellis Island after the storm rolled over New York City Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: Large lizard sees off noisy dog with a SLAP of its powerful tail
item.description: A water monitor was filmed whipping a dog across the face with its tail while another dog barked. The was video shared on social media by airline worker Suthida Sri' from Bangkok, Thailand.

item.title: Palestinian son climbs hospital to sit on window ledge of mother's room until her death
item.description: Jihad Al-Suwaiti, 30, was not allowed to visit his mother, Rasma Salema, in person after she tested positive for coronavirus and was admitted to a hospital in Hebron, in the West Bank.

item.title: Kanye West and Kim Kardashian have been moving toward divorce in recent weeks
item.description: Kanye West and Kim Kardashian have been considering divorcing for weeks, multiple sources told People. The report follows West's bizarre behavior at a rally and his disturbing tweets.

item.title: Inside Eurostar's £245 Business Premier class in the coronavirus era
item.description: The regular first class experience with Eurostar is amazing, with a menu overseen by superchef Raymond Blanc and swanky lounges. Right now it's rather different, as Ted Thornhill discovered.

item.title: British tourist, 47, breaks her back plunging off a 60ft balcony in Ibiza while having a NIGHTMARE
item.description: College worker Coral Skipp, 47, from Powys in Wales, was on the last night of her sunshine break when she fell from the third floor of the building.

item.title: MP warns Downing Street not to let Dominic Cummings 'anywhere near' ISC
item.description: Julian Lewis has demanded a 'categorical commitment' from Downing Street that Mr Cummings and other political special advisers will not be allowed 'anywhere near' the ISC.

item.title: Guest who fractured skull falling off rickshaw at Sandhurst charity ball loses compensation claim
item.description: Sophie Ashraf, 28, of Staines, was a guest enjoying an oriental-themed black tie ball at Sandhurst, in Berks, when she was hurt in June 2015.

item.title: MPs blast Government for 'astonishing' failures in pandemic planning
item.description: The Public Accounts Committee (PAC) has published a scathing report which suggests ministers were badly under-prepared to respond to an outbreak like the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: 'Sentient' homes and 'intelligent' food could feature in the lives of our children 30 years from now
item.description: Futurist Brian David Johnson spoke to children aged 8-13 as part of a study into their vision of life in the 2050s for the Institution of Engineering and Technology (IET).

item.title: Viktoria Brandt who ditched the rat race to become a tradwife who gets up at 5am each day to clean
item.description: Viktoria Brandt, 43, from Sweden, ditched the rat race after suffering with burnout has reinvented herself as a 'tradwife' who gets up at 5am each day to start her chores.

item.title: Artist who specialises in tattooing the roof of people's MOUTHS shows off his unique artwork
item.description: Indy Voet, who works at The Purple Sun tattoo parlour in Brussels, is well known for doing permanent tattoos in unconventional places - including on people's fingers and behind ears.

item.title: New mother who forgave her husband's affair with a 'twenty-something' after she gave birth slammed
item.description: The unnamed British woman, 34, took to parenting forum Mumsnet to ask other mothers for their advice, after doubting her decision to stay with her childhood sweetheart.

item.title: Woody Johnson says claims of racist and sexist remarks are false
item.description: US officials had investigated Woody Johnson after he made 'generalisations about black men' and 'cringeworthy' comments about the appearances of women, CNN reported.

item.title: The least reliable used cars and models in 2020 revealed
item.description: Luxurious SUVs, like the ones pictured, tend to be jammed full of electronics and have complicated and expensive suspension systems. And when these things go wrong, they result in hefty garage bills.

item.title: Indian girl, three, is gang-raped by two men who choked her to death
item.description: The two suspects tied a cloth around the girl's face while raping her before choking her to death in the city of Chhindwara, police believe (stock photo).

item.title: Boris Johnson says economy will be back on an 'even keel' BEFORE 2024
item.description: The British economy will be back on an 'even keel' before the 2024 general election, Boris Johnson told Tory MPs last night as he said 'slowly but surely' life in the UK will return to normal.

item.title: Donald Trump boasts once more of acing the cognitive test: 'For me it was easy'
item.description: Donald Trump has touted his 'amazing' performance in a mental capacity test, telling Fox News that his doctors were surprised at his memory. The president said that Joe Biden should take the same test.

item.title: Mobile phone masts as high as Nelson's Column will be allowed without full planning permission
item.description: Phone masts as tall as Nelson's Column will be allowed to be put up in rural areas of the UK without full planning permission, to improve 5G signal.

item.title: Boohoo's billionaire owners may have to tear down 'unsightly' gates at their £2.8m Georgian mansion
item.description: Mahmud Kamani is at war with his wealthy Cheshire neighbours over the controversial gates he built at their Grade II listed mansion in 2017 and have applied for retrospective planning permission.

item.title: Russian nurse who wore see-through protective gown becomes a TV weather presenter
item.description: Nadia Zhukova, 23, seen wearing only lingerie under her transparent PPE as she gave patients their medicine, had initially been disciplined by bosses at the Tula Regional Clinical Hospital.

item.title: You've been meaning to start investing but are paralysed by choice? ADRIAN LOWERY's five tips
item.description: Which investing Isa account to sign up for and what to invest in? The choice is baffling, but there are ways to just 'get it done'. It's not perfect. But you can refine it over time.

item.title: Wedding guest frustrated after being sent a VERY strict dress code by the bride and groom
item.description: A wedding guest has shared the 'strictly enforced' dress code a bride and groom sent her before the big day, frustrated by the lengthy list of rules.

item.title: High-end mobile phones price have soared 490% in 20 years
item.description: The outlay for a top of the range model is close to heading back to the early 1990s, when a Motorola 3200 cost £762 - or £1,651 when adjusted for inflation.

item.title: Tuck into a (teetotal) tinnie! This summer there's a new breed of mocktails
item.description: Sudi Pigott gives verdict on a selection of the best pre-mixed mocktails available in the UK, as the the Office for National Statistics adds gin-in-a-tin to this year's 'Nation's Shopping Basket.

item.title: Dior presents its 2021 cruise collection on the catwalk to an empty venue as 20million watch
item.description: Tonight's show, which was postponed from May 27, took place in the the Piazza del Duomo in Lecce, Puglia, with a small audience of 1,000, consisting of artisans, press and executives.

item.title: What to wear this weekend: FEMAIL picks out the best oversize shirts
item.description: Camilla Ridley-Day shares advice for embracing this season's oversize shirts trend at any occasion. The British style expert also picked out a selection of the best pieces available from online stores.
